author.name: Dr. Mohamed El Fadil
author.bio_short: Sudanese-Saudi physician, AI entrepreneur, and founder of BrainSAIT
author.bio_long: Dr. Mohamed El Fadil is a physician and technology entrepreneur who bridges the worlds of medicine and artificial intelligence. Born in Sudan, educated in Saudi Arabia, he founded BrainSAIT to revolutionize healthcare through AI-powered solutions. His work aligns with Saudi Vision 2030's digital transformation goals.

description.short: A powerful memoir of transformation—from witnessing an execution at age three in Sudan, to building AI healthcare solutions in Saudi Arabia. Through the lens of geology, Dr. Mohamed El Fadil shows how life's cracks become engines of innovation.
description.long:
Geology of the Soul is more than a memoir—it's a philosophical exploration of how pressure, time, and layers create identity. Dr. Mohamed El Fadil takes readers on an extraordinary journey from the banks of the Nile to the digital frontier of Saudi Arabia's Vision 2030.

At age three, he witnessed a public execution that shattered his childhood. Exiled to his grandfather's home, bullied at school, he learned that survival requires more than intelligence—it requires understanding systems. From poverty in Khartoum to medical school in Riyadh, from clinical practice to founding BrainSAIT, an AI healthcare company, this is a story of continuous transformation.

Using geological metaphors—cracks, layers, pressure, and engines—Dr. El Fadil reveals how trauma can become fuel, how migration creates new identities, and how systems thinking can revolutionize healthcare. His six teachers—Death, Sacred Texts, his grandfather Maki, Pain, the Theater of Life, and his son—shaped a journey from treating individual patients to building systems that serve millions.

This book speaks to anyone carrying their own 'cracks,' searching for their 'engine,' or dreaming of creating impact beyond themselves. It's a testament to resilience, innovation, and the power of seeing challenges not as endings, but as passages for light.

audience.primary: Adults 25-55 interested in memoirs, entrepreneurship, healthcare innovation
audience.secondary: Medical professionals, tech entrepreneurs, migrants, Arab diaspora

description_arabic.short: مذكرات تحوُّل قوية — من مشاهدة القصاص في سن الثالثة بتبوك، إلى بناء حلول ذكاء اصطناعي للرعاية الصحية في السعودية. عبر مجاز الجيولوجيا، يبيّن د. محمد الفاضل كيف تتحوّل الصدوع إلى محركات للابتكار.
description_arabic.long: جيولوجيا الروح ليست مجرد سيرة ذاتية، بل محاولة لرسم خريطة جيولوجية للروح: كيف تتشكل الصدوع وتتراكم الرواسب، وكيف يحول الضغط والزمن الألم إلى رؤية. تبدأ الرحلة بصدمة مبكرة، تمر بالمنفى وتكوين الصحراء، ثم الطب حيث يُكتشف حد النظام، لتنتهي عند بناء محرك (MASTERLINC) ينسّق عقولاً صناعية لخدمة صحة الإنسان ضمن رؤية السعودية 2030.
